Package org.arl.fjage.connectors

Class WebServer

java.lang.Object
org.arl.fjage.connectors.WebServer
public class WebServer extends Object
Web server instance manager.

  • Constructor Details

    • WebServer

      protected WebServer(int port)

    • WebServer

      protected WebServer(int port, String ip)
      Creates a new web server instance.
      The Jetty based WebServer has a set of handlers that are initialized and more handlers can be added to it. The handler stack setup is

      GzipHandler -> RewriteHandler -> ContextHandlerCollection[ contexts[] , DefaultHandler]

      Any new handlers added to the server will be added to the list of ContextHandlers (contexts).
      Parameters:
      port - HTTP port number.
      ip - IP address to bind HTTP server to.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static WebServer getInstance(int port)
      Gets an instance of a web server running on the specified port. If an instance is not already available, a new one is created.
      Parameters:
      port - HTTP port number.

    • getInstance

      public static WebServer getInstance(int port, String ip)
      Gets an instance of a web server running on the specified port. If an instance is not already available, a new one is created.
      Parameters:
      port - HTTP port number.
      ip - IP address to bind HTTP server to.

    • hasInstance

      public static boolean hasInstance(int port)
      Checks if an instance of a web server is running on the specified port.
      Parameters:
      port - HTTP port number.
      Returns:
      true if running, false otherwise.

      Returns:
      array of web server instances.

      Returns:
      TCP port number.

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the web server.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops the web server. Once this method is called, the server cannot be restarted.

    • addUpload

      public boolean addUpload(String context, File dir)
      Adds a context to upload files to.
      Parameters:
      context - context path.
      dir - filesystem path of directory to upload files to.
      Returns:
      true if added, false otherwise.

    • addUpload

      public boolean addUpload(String context, File dir, long maxFileSize, long maxRequestSize, int fileSizeThreshold)
      Adds a context to upload files to.
      Parameters:
      context - context path.
      dir - filesystem path of directory to upload files to.
      maxFileSize - maximum size of a file. @see javax.servlet.MultipartConfigElement
      maxRequestSize - maximum size of a request. @see javax.servlet.MultipartConfigElement
      fileSizeThreshold - size threshold after which files will be written to disk. @see javax.servlet.MultipartConfigElement
      Returns:
      true if added, false otherwise.

    • addRule

      public boolean addRule(org.eclipse.jetty.rewrite.handler.Rule rule)
      Adds a rule to rewrite handler.

      NOTE: Rules cannot be added after the server is started.

      Parameters:
      rule - rewrite rule.
      Returns:
      true if added, false otherwise.
